oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Map of proposed TVA dams
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sketch of the Tennessee Valley Authority Area showing the locations of various dams.

The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) was created by the Tennessee Valley Authority Act, which President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed into law in 1933. One of the purposes of the TVA was to provide cheap electricity for rural electrification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: New Deal, 1933-1939--Tennessee; Tennessee Valley Authority--History; Rural electrification--Government policy--United States; Rural electrification--Tennessee; Rural electrification--United States--History
